description: First floor side to rear extension; alterations and extension to roof to form end gable; rear dormer; two rooflights in front roof slope
decision_conditions: <p>The&nbsp;proposed extensions would breach the horizontal 45 degree line of both adjacent properties leading to considerable overshadowing of the rear garden and loss of outlook to habitable windows in proximity to the shared boundary of both 9 &amp; 13 Coledale Drive, contrary to the high quality design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy D3.D1 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design Guide (2010).</p>

<p>The&nbsp;proposed two-storey side and rear extensions, in
conjunction with the rear roof dormer, by reason of their excessive cumulative
scale,&nbsp; poor and inconsistent design and failure to harmonise with host property, would result in an incongruous, overly dominant, top heavy and visually obtrusive form of development at odds with the prevailing visual character
of both the host property and wider area.&nbsp; As such, the proposal is contrary to the high quality
design aspirations of the National Planning Policy Framework (2023), Policy
D3.D1 and D11 of The London Plan (2021), Core Policy CS1.B of the Harrow Core
Strategy (2012), Policy DM1 of the Harrow Development Management Policies Local
Plan (2013) and the adopted Supplementary Planning Document: Residential Design
Guide (2010).</p>
